page.title: 01Old Barony of Ruskie (North)
page.content: This area has much changed since the Earls of Meutieth and Sir John de Meutieth of Rusky. After the feudal system with Ox-towns,the Napiers were the Lords (logarithm Napier is said to have thought up the idea on Loch Rusky!). The great enclosure period saw the Grahams enthusiastic about improvements - simple tenancy farms. The decline in agriculture since the 1960's has seen block planting of conifers, extensive hill farming, reduction in population in farming. Deer farming and tourism is important, but appearance has been neglected. The Forestry Commission is very inefficient and not good at growing trees. Private planting is better. the loch is stocked with rainbow trout. There is talk of acid rain, trees also bring acid problems.
